content.description: On the Seattle Wall (previously the Upper Wall) At the ground, start to the left of the boulder, looking up at a little roof. Shift to the right just under the roof, and follow a small crack up to a ledge you can rest on. Move back to the left and continue just until the base of the big boulder, then shift right once again to finish at the top of the boulder.
content.protection: Webbing or static ~50 ft. needed to reach a few trees.
content.location: Seen as the highest route in Picnic Area, on the Seattle Wall. Take note of the large boulder at the top (snowflake when climbed in December)

content.description: This cliff is above Picnic wall Right and Left.  It is a bit taller, a bit scrappier and has the least development to date.
